title: Señorío de Sotillo 2014 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Lightly green, grassy notes are detectable on a gritty, horsey nose. This feels soupy and strained, although there's enough balance to make it worthy of a go. Stewy, herbal black-fruit flavors finish tannic.

title: Sileni 2014 Cellar Selection Pinot Noir (Hawke's Bay)
description: Already showing hints of age-related decay, this is a bit mushroomy and earthy, with attenuated strawberry fruit. It does still have a decently silky texture, so enjoy it over the next year or so.

title: Vignobles Ravel 2015 Château l'Oasis Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: With its classic blend of Grenache, Cinsault and Syrah, this wine is crisp and bright with peach and citrus flavors. The acidity is lively and perfumed with summer blossom. It finishes with fruit and freshness.

title: Renwood 2015 Rosé (Amador County)
description: This wine looks lighter than it tastes. It has a pale pink color, peach and cherry aromas, candied flavors and a rich, soft texture.

title: Scott Family 2014 Estate Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Baked pineapple and burnt sugar rise out of the glass before the palate unfurls a super-concentrated body and big presence of oak, the texture and tension of the wine still looking for resolution.

title: Wilson 2011 Ellie's Vineyard Estate Petite Sirah (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This is a mild-mannered, softly one-dimensional version of the variety, robust in chocolate mocha and blueberry jam that finishes easily.

title: Three Thieves 2013 California Republic Red (California)
description: An aroma like strawberry jam and equally ripe flavors give this medium-bodied and bargain-priced wine a friendly, outgoing personality. It feels slightly rounded with sweetness and has just a touch of tannin to firm up the mouthfeel.

title: Tres Ojos 2012 Garnacha (Calatayud)
description: This is a touch stalky and rough on the nose, while in the mouth it's raw, choppy and boxed in. Cherry and plum flavors pick up speed on the palate and taste slightly gamy and burnt on the finish.

title: Broglia 2014 La Meirana del Comune di Gavi  (Gavi)
description: Lightly scented, this opens with aromas suggesting white spring flower and orchard fruit. The rather lean, racy palate offers unripe apple, a hint of citrus and a medicinal note alongside brisk acidity.
designation: La Meirana del Comune di Gavi

title: Buena Vista 2013 Arpad's Selection Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)
description: Raisin-baked plum defines this hearty, full-bodied and ultraripe wine, rich in red berry and robust on the finish.

title: Bougrier 2015 Alain de la Treille Le Rosé Rosé (Vin de France)
description: Soft and gently fruity, this has red-currant as well as red-plum flavors lightly cut with acidity. The aftertaste is soft, almost off dry. It is immediately attractive and drinkable.
designation: Alain de la Treille Le Rosé

title: Churchill Cellars 2013 Burke Family Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine is quite clear in the glass and a touch tart on the palate, finding its way to a full-bodied, slightly flabby and gummy texture and sense of heaviness.

title: Cuvée Lion d'Or 2015 White (Vin de France)
description: A blend of Grenache Blanc and Viognier, this is attractive, fruity and perfumed. Touches of apricot balance with the green fruits and herbal edge. It's an easy wine to drink, best as an apéritif.

title: Castle Rock 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino)
description: Aromas like dried herbs and flavors like green apple and pear nectar make a colorful combination in this medium-bodied wine.

title: Château de Saint Martin 2015 Cuvée Grand Réserve Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: This wine is soft, gently fruity with light raspberry and red-currant flavors. An attractive zesty lemon character adds to this pale-colored wine.

title: Domaines Pierre Chavin 2015 Lavandelle Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: This organically grown wine celebrates lavender, used for perfumes and other famous products from Provence. Soft and gently fruity with attractive strawberry flavors plus a touch of spice, the wine is immediately drinkable as an apéritif.

title: FlyWine 2013 The Closer Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Innocuous red fruit and a density of baked plum provide a fruity plushness in this travel-size wine, 100% varietal with ample tannin.

title: Marchetti 2015  Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico
description: Aromas of tropical fruit and citrus lead the nose on this simple white. The bright, refreshing palate offers grapefruit and lemon zest alongside brisk acidity.
region_1: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

title: Marco Porello 2014 Camestri  (Roero)
description: Subdued aromas of pressed blossom, fennel and orchard fruit come together on this. The lean, rather diluted palate offers hints of green pear, citrus rind and a mineral note alongside tangy acidity.

title: Matchbook 2015 Estate Rosé (Dunnigan Hills)
description: Not a delicate wine, this has a deep, bright pink color, smells like raspberries, tastes strongly of cherries, and has relatively full body with a mouthcoating texture. Enjoy it like a red wine with something flavorful.

title: Sommos 2009 Premium Red (Somontano)
description: Sweet, candied aromas of milk chocolate and baked beans are odd and difficult to process— in a word, the nose smells unnatural. A sticky, syrupy palate combines heavy oak and ripe fruit, while the flavor profile is like a chocolate milkshake with baked cherry thrown in. Tempranillo, Merlot and Syrah are the blend.

title: Ravoire et Fils 2015 Les Trois Sources Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: With 60% Grenache in the blend, this is classic fruity, perfumed rosé. Produced from a range of vineyards, it is light, ripe with gentle red fruits and has a soft, if bone-dry, aftertaste.

title: Peter Cellars 2012 Estate Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: This is a leathery, thick and robust wine that shows more presence of black tea and tannin than tang of fruit.

title: Murdoch James 2014 Estate Pinot Noir (Martinborough)
description: Clean and fruit-forward, this relatively light-bodied wine doesn't show the richness or complexity that made Martinborough famous. It's a pleasant mix of tart cherries and vanilla-tinged oak with a trace of dustiness on the finish.

title: Stylo 2014 Old Vines Garnacha (Calatayud)
description: Berry aromas are straightforward and solid enough. This has a sticky, grabby mouthfeel and oaky flavors of plum and stewed berries. All in all, it's a decent wine with a slathering of vanilla oak on the finish.

title: Nieto Senetiner 2013 Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)
description: More crisp and spicy than overtly fruity on the nose, this is both bulky and high in acidity. A blast of savory plum flavor is the main show, while noticeable oak and pepper notes turn dry and wiry on the finish.

title: Le Pépin 2015 Moscato (Vin de France)
description: Ripe peach and nectarine aromas and flavors are at the forefront of this friendly, approachable Moscato, with touches of melon, pear and sweet orange to round it out. The palate is bright and balanced, with solid stone-fruit and pear flavors that finish fresh and easy.

title: Le Petit Cochonnet 2015 Malbec (Vin de France)
description: Capitalizing on the fashion for Malbec, this wine is closer to Argentina than Cahors. It has soft tannins and a ripe and juicy flavor of red-berry fruits. Acidity and a soft aftertaste reinforce this New World feel.

title: Lenz Moser 2015 Prestige Grüner Veltliner (Austria)
description: The nose gives little away, the clean palate falls in line with almost equal neutrality. It's only on the aftertaste that you get some of that savory yeastiness we so associate with fresh, young Grüner. Drink soon while there still is some freshness.

title: Les Vins Bréban 2015 Domaine Valfont Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)
description: This refreshing wine has lively acidity followed by red fruits and a soft texture. It is a round wine, hinting at sweetness because of the ripeness.
